definition: surname Li/abbr. for 禮記|礼记[Li3 ji4], Classic of Rites

sentences.english: It was a cold winter’s day that Sunday.
sentences.chinese: 這是冬季裏的一個寒冷的禮拜天。

sentences.english: Did you know those are 20% off until Sunday.
sentences.chinese: 你知道到禮拜天爲止那些都打八折嗎？

sentences.english: I mentioned that we couldn't work on Sundays.
sentences.chinese: 我說我們禮拜天不能工作。

sentences.english: We go to school everyday except Sunday.
sentences.chinese: 除禮拜天中，我們每天上教。

sentences.english: Sunday morning, we come home beat up and sleep all afternoon.
sentences.chinese: 禮拜天早上，我們鼻青臉腫地回家然後睡一個下午。

sentences.english: Sundays are spent mostly in church.
sentences.chinese: 禮拜天大多在教堂裏度過。

sentences.english: Last Sunday Lin Hao, one of my classmates, and I went to a bookstore.
sentences.chinese: 上禮拜天，我和我的同窗林昊去了書店。
我們將在禮拜天前晌脫離。

sentences.english: We'll let you accept our close offer next Sunday.
sentences.chinese: 下禮拜天我們就向你們發實盤。

sentences.english: Eels for sale at a Sunday morning market, Shanghai.
sentences.chinese: 禮拜天早上小菜場裏的黃鱔。

sentences.english: Because today is Sunday, his holiday!
sentences.chinese: 由於今天是禮拜天，他地沐日。

sentences.english: Weve received the sample which you dispatched us last Sun.
sentences.chinese: 我們曾經收到了上禮拜天你方寄來的樣品，。

sentences.english: Yang Ling the violin the concert last Sunday.
sentences.chinese: 在上禮拜天的音樂會上，楊玲拉了提琴。

definition: to go to church on Sunday (of Christians)
lit. to rush at thin air/fig. to miss one's aim/to have nothing to show for one's troubles
matins/morning service (in the Catholic Church)/morning chorus (of birds)
the Lantern Festival (15th of first month of lunar calendar)
When you enter a village, follow the local customs (idiom); do as the natives do/When in Rome, do as the Romans do
to try one's luck/to leave sth to chance
to go to market/to go to a fair
